availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer. Washington County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Litsey and Mary Litsey. Married to Catharine Litsey. Father of John D. Litsey, Squire J. Litsey, George M. Litsey, Cassa Litsey, Jesse B. Litsey, James H. Litsey, and Anthony T. Litsey. Farmer in Grayson County in 1850 and 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 26. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 146. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Haynes, p. 35. _ Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910)_, microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Grayson County, Deaths, 1877, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
